pli-tv-bu-vb-sk65:0.2_0: The monks’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk65:0.5_0: The training rule on obstructing one’s finger and then
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk65:1.1_0: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk65:1.2_0: At that time the monks from the group of six gave teachings to people who were seated clasping their knees. ...
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk65:1.3.1_0: “‘I will not give a teaching to anyone who is seated clasping their knees and who is not sick,’ this is how you should train.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk65:1.4_0: One should not give a teaching to anyone who is seated clasping their knees and who is not sick.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk65:1.5_0: If a monk, out of disrespect, gives a teaching to someone who is clasping their knees with their hands or with a cloth and who is not sick, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk65:1.7.1_0: or it has not been trusted ...
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk65:1.9_0: The fifth rule, the training rule on fifth, is finished.
